00036 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00037 // disable false positive warning C4806:
00038 //   '&': unsafe operation: no value of type 'bool' promoted to type
00039 //   'const sc_dt::sc_digit' can equal the given constant
00040 // triggered by calling sc_subref<sc_bv_base>::get_cword
00041 // TODO: optimize get_cword for bit ranges to avoid check entirely
00042 #pragma warning(push)
00043 #pragma warning(disable:4806)
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 namespace sc_dt
00047 {
00048 
00049 // classes defined in this module
00050 template <class X, class Traits> class sc_bitref_conv_r;
00051 template <class X> class sc_bitref_r;
00052 template <class X> class sc_bitref;
00053 template <class X> class sc_subref_r;
00054 template <class X> class sc_subref;
00055 template <class X, class Y> class sc_concref_r;
00056 template <class X, class Y> class sc_concref;
00057 
00058 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00059 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_bitref_conv_r<T>
00060 //
00061 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy bit selection (r-value only, boolean conversion).
00062 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00063 template<class T, class Traits = typename T::traits_type>
00064 class sc_bitref_conv_r { /* empty by default */ };
00065 
00066 // specialization for bit-vector based sc_proxy classes
00067 template<typename T>
00068 class sc_bitref_conv_r<T, sc_proxy_traits<sc_bv_base> >
00069 {
00070 public:
00071 #if IEEE_1666_CPLUSPLUS >= 201103L // explicit operator needs C++11
00072     // explicit conversion to bool
00073     explicit operator bool() const {
00074         return static_cast<const sc_bitref_r<T>&>(*this).to_bool();
00075     }
00076 #endif
00077 
00078     // explicit (negating) conversion to bool
00079     bool operator!() const {
00080         return ! static_cast<const sc_bitref_r<T>&>(*this).to_bool();
00081     }
00082 };
00083 
00084 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00085 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_bitref_r<T>
00086 //
00087 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy bit selection (r-value only).
00088 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089 
00090 template <class T>
00091 class sc_bitref_r
00092   : public sc_bitref_conv_r<T>
00093 {
00094     friend class sc_bv_base;
00095     friend class sc_lv_base;
00096 
00097 public:
00098 
00099     // typedefs
00100 
00101     typedef typename T::traits_type          traits_type;
00102     typedef typename traits_type::bit_type   bit_type;
00103     typedef typename traits_type::value_type value_type;
00104 
00105     // constructor
00106 
00107     sc_bitref_r( const T& obj_, int index_ )
00108         : m_obj( const_cast<T&>( obj_ ) ), m_index( index_ )
00109         {}
00110 
00111 
00112     // copy constructor
00113 
00114     sc_bitref_r( const sc_bitref_r<T>& a )
00115         : m_obj( a.m_obj ), m_index( a.m_index )
00116         {}
00117 
00118     // cloning
00119 
00120     sc_bitref_r<T>* clone() const
00121         { return new sc_bitref_r<T>( *this ); }
00122 
00123 
00124     // bitwise operators and functions
00125 
00126     // bitwise complement
00127 
00128     bit_type operator ~ () const
00129         { return bit_type( sc_logic::not_table[value()] ); }
00130 
00131 
00132     // implicit conversion to bit_type
00133 
00134     operator bit_type() const
00135         { return bit_type( m_obj.get_bit( m_index ) ); }
00136 
00137 
00138     // explicit conversions
00139 
00140     value_type value() const
00141         { return m_obj.get_bit( m_index ); }
00142 
00143 
00144     bool is_01() const
00145         { return sc_logic( value() ).is_01(); }
00146 
00147     bool to_bool() const
00148         { return sc_logic( value() ).to_bool(); }
00149 
00150     char to_char() const
00151         { return sc_logic( value() ).to_char(); }
00152 
00153 
00154     // common methods
00155 
00156     int length() const
00157         { return 1; }
00158 
00159     int size() const
00160         { return ( (length() - 1) / SC_DIGIT_SIZE + 1 ); }
00161 
00162     value_type get_bit( int n ) const;
00163 
00164     sc_digit get_word( int i ) const;
00165     sc_digit get_cword( int i ) const;
00166 
00167 
00168     // other methods
00169 
00170     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00171         { os << to_char(); }
00172 
00173 protected:
00174 
00175     T&  m_obj;
00176     int m_index;
00177 
00178 private:
00179 
00180     // disabled
00181     sc_bitref_r();
00182     sc_bitref_r<T>& operator = ( const sc_bitref_r<T>& );
00183 };
00184

00475 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00476 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_bitref<X>
00477 //
00478 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy bit selection (r-value and l-value).
00479 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00480 
00481 template <class X>
00482 class sc_bitref
00483     : public sc_bitref_r<X>
00484 {
00485     friend class sc_bv_base;
00486     friend class sc_lv_base;
00487 
00488 public:
00489     typedef typename sc_bitref_r<X>::value_type value_type;
00490 
00491     // constructor
00492 
00493     sc_bitref( X& obj_, int index_ )
00494         : sc_bitref_r<X>( obj_, index_ )
00495         {}
00496 
00497 
00498     // copy constructor
00499 
00500     sc_bitref( const sc_bitref<X>& a )
00501         : sc_bitref_r<X>( a )
00502         {}
00503 
00504 
00505     // cloning
00506 
00507     sc_bitref<X>* clone() const
00508         { return new sc_bitref<X>( *this ); }
00509 
00510 
00511     // assignment operators
00512 
00513     sc_bitref<X>& operator = ( const sc_bitref_r<X>& a );
00514     sc_bitref<X>& operator = ( const sc_bitref<X>& a );
00515 
00516     sc_bitref<X>& operator = ( const sc_logic& a )
00517         { this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index, a.value() ); return *this; }
00518 
00519     sc_bitref<X>& operator = ( sc_logic_value_t v )
00520         { *this = sc_logic( v ); return *this; }
00521 
00522     sc_bitref<X>& operator = ( bool a )
00523         { *this = sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00524 
00525     sc_bitref<X>& operator = ( char a )
00526         { *this = sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00527 
00528     sc_bitref<X>& operator = ( int a )
00529         { *this = sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00530 
00531     sc_bitref<X>& operator = ( const sc_bit& a )
00532         { *this = sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00533 
00534 
00535     // bitwise assignment operators
00536 
00537     sc_bitref<X>& operator &= ( const sc_bitref_r<X>& a );
00538     sc_bitref<X>& operator &= ( const sc_logic& a );
00539 
00540     sc_bitref<X>& operator &= ( sc_logic_value_t v )
00541         { *this &= sc_logic( v ); return *this; }
00542 
00543     sc_bitref<X>& operator &= ( bool a )
00544         { *this &= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00545 
00546     sc_bitref<X>& operator &= ( char a )
00547         { *this &= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00548 
00549     sc_bitref<X>& operator &= ( int a )
00550         { *this &= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00551 
00552 
00553     sc_bitref<X>& operator |= ( const sc_bitref_r<X>& a );
00554     sc_bitref<X>& operator |= ( const sc_logic& a );
00555 
00556     sc_bitref<X>& operator |= ( sc_logic_value_t v )
00557         { *this |= sc_logic( v ); return *this; }
00558 
00559     sc_bitref<X>& operator |= ( bool a )
00560         { *this |= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00561 
00562     sc_bitref<X>& operator |= ( char a )
00563         { *this |= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00564 
00565     sc_bitref<X>& operator |= ( int a )
00566         { *this |= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00567 
00568 
00569     sc_bitref<X>& operator ^= ( const sc_bitref_r<X>& a );
00570     sc_bitref<X>& operator ^= ( const sc_logic& a );
00571 
00572     sc_bitref<X>& operator ^= ( sc_logic_value_t v )
00573         { *this ^= sc_logic( v ); return *this; }
00574 
00575     sc_bitref<X>& operator ^= ( bool a )
00576         { *this ^= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00577 
00578     sc_bitref<X>& operator ^= ( char a )
00579         { *this ^= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00580 
00581     sc_bitref<X>& operator ^= ( int a )
00582         { *this ^= sc_logic( a ); return *this; }
00583 
00584 
00585     // bitwise operators and functions
00586 
00587     // bitwise complement
00588 
00589     sc_bitref<X>& b_not();
00590 
00591 
00592     // common methods
00593 
00594     void set_bit( int n, value_type value );
00595 
00596     void set_word( int i, sc_digit w );
00597     void set_cword( int i, sc_digit w );
00598 
00599     void clean_tail()
00600         { this->m_obj.clean_tail(); }
00601 
00602 
00603     // other methods
00604 
00605     void scan( ::std::istream& is = ::std::cin );
00606 
00607 private:
00608 
00609     // disabled
00610     sc_bitref();
00611 };

00646 
00647 template <class T1, class T2, class T3>
00648 inline
00649 sc_concref<sc_bitref<T1>,sc_concref<T2,T3> >
00650 concat( sc_bitref<T1>, sc_concref<T2,T3> );
00651 
00652 template <class T1, class T2>
00653 inline
00654 sc_concref<sc_bitref<T1>,T2>
00655 concat( sc_bitref<T1>, sc_proxy<T2>& );
00656

00659 ::std::istream&
00660 operator >> ( ::std::istream&, sc_bitref<T> );

00662 
00663 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00664 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_subref_r<X>
00665 //
00666 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy part selection (r-value only).
00667 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00668 
00669 template <class X>
00670 class sc_subref_r
00671     : public sc_proxy<sc_subref_r<X> >
00672 {
00673     void check_bounds();
00674 
00675 public:
00676     typedef typename sc_proxy<sc_subref_r<X> >::value_type value_type;
00677 
00678     // constructor
00679 
00680     sc_subref_r( const X& obj_, int hi_, int lo_ )
00681         : m_obj( const_cast<X&>( obj_ ) ), m_hi( hi_ ), m_lo( lo_ ), m_len( 0 )
00682         { check_bounds(); }
00683 
00684 
00685     // copy constructor
00686 
00687     sc_subref_r( const sc_subref_r<X>& a )
00688         : m_obj( a.m_obj ), m_hi( a.m_hi ), m_lo( a.m_lo ), m_len( a.m_len )
00689         {}
00690 
00691 
00692     // cloning
00693 
00694     sc_subref_r<X>* clone() const
00695         { return new sc_subref_r<X>( *this ); }
00696 
00697 
00698     // common methods
00699 
00700     int length() const
00701         { return m_len; }
00702 
00703     int size() const
00704         { return ( (length() - 1) / SC_DIGIT_SIZE + 1 ); }
00705 
00706     value_type get_bit( int n ) const;
00707     void set_bit( int n, value_type value );
00708 
00709     sc_digit get_word( int i )const;
00710     void set_word( int i, sc_digit w );
00711 
00712     sc_digit get_cword( int i ) const;
00713     void set_cword( int i, sc_digit w );
00714 
00715     void clean_tail()
00716         { m_obj.clean_tail(); }
00717 
00718 
00719     // other methods
00720 
00721     bool is_01() const;
00722 
00723     bool reversed() const
00724         { return m_lo > m_hi; }
00725 
00726 protected:
00727 
00728     X&  m_obj;
00729     int m_hi;
00730     int m_lo;
00731     int m_len;
00732 
00733 private:
00734 
00735     // disabled
00736     sc_subref_r();
00737     sc_subref_r<X>& operator = ( const sc_subref_r<X>& );
00738 };

00991 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00992 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_subref<X>
00993 //
00994 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy part selection (r-value and l-value).
00995 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00996 
00997 template <class X>
00998 class sc_subref
00999     : public sc_subref_r<X>
01000 {
01001 public:
01002 
01003     // typedefs
01004 
01005     typedef sc_subref_r<X> base_type;
01006 
01007 
01008     // constructor
01009 
01010     sc_subref( X& obj_, int hi_, int lo_ )
01011         : sc_subref_r<X>( obj_, hi_, lo_ )
01012         {}
01013 
01014 
01015     // copy constructor
01016 
01017     sc_subref( const sc_subref<X>& a )
01018         : sc_subref_r<X>( a )
01019         {}
01020 
01021 
01022     // cloning
01023 
01024     sc_subref<X>* clone() const
01025         { return new sc_subref<X>( *this ); }
01026 
01027 
01028     // assignment operators
01029 
01030     template <class Y>
01031     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const sc_proxy<Y>& a )
01032         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01033 
01034     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const sc_subref_r<X>& a );
01035     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const sc_subref<X>& a );
01036 
01037     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const char* a )
01038         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01039 
01040     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const bool* a )
01041         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01042 
01043     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const sc_logic* a )
01044         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01045 
01046     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const sc_unsigned& a )
01047         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01048 
01049     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const sc_signed& a )
01050         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01051 
01052     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const sc_uint_base& a )
01053         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01054 
01055     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( const sc_int_base& a )
01056         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01057 
01058     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( unsigned long a )
01059         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01060 
01061     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( long a )
01062         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01063 
01064     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( unsigned int a )
01065         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01066 
01067     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( int a )
01068         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01069 
01070     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( uint64 a )
01071         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01072 
01073     sc_subref<X>& operator = ( int64 a )
01074         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01075 
01076 
01077     // other methods
01078 
01079     void scan( ::std::istream& = ::std::cin );
01080 
01081 private:
01082 
01083     // disabled
01084     sc_subref();
01085 };

01138 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01139 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_concref_r<X,Y>
01140 //
01141 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy concatenation (r-value only).
01142 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01143 
01144 template <class X, class Y>
01145 class sc_concref_r
01146     : public sc_proxy<sc_concref_r<X,Y> >
01147 {
01148 public:
01149     typedef typename sc_proxy<sc_concref_r<X,Y> >::value_type value_type;
01150 
01151     // constructor
01152 
01153     sc_concref_r( const X& left_, const Y& right_, int delete_ = 0 )
01154         : m_left( const_cast<X&>( left_ ) ), m_right( const_cast<Y&>( right_ ) ),
01155           m_delete( delete_ ), m_refs( *new int( 1 ) )
01156         {}
01157 
01158 
01159     // copy constructor
01160 
01161     sc_concref_r( const sc_concref_r<X,Y>& a )
01162         : m_left( a.m_left ), m_right( a.m_right ),
01163           m_delete( a.m_delete ), m_refs( a.m_refs )
01164         { ++ m_refs; }
01165 
01166 
01167     // destructor
01168 
01169     virtual ~sc_concref_r();
01170 
01171 
01172     // cloning
01173 
01174     sc_concref_r<X,Y>* clone() const
01175         { return new sc_concref_r<X,Y>( *this ); }
01176 
01177 
01178     // common methods
01179 
01180     int length() const
01181         { return ( m_left.length() + m_right.length() ); }
01182 
01183     int size() const
01184         { return ( (length() - 1) / SC_DIGIT_SIZE + 1 ); }
01185 
01186     value_type get_bit( int n ) const;
01187     void set_bit( int n, value_type value );
01188 
01189     sc_digit get_word( int i ) const;
01190     void set_word( int i, sc_digit w );
01191 
01192     sc_digit get_cword( int i ) const;
01193     void set_cword( int i, sc_digit w );
01194 
01195     void clean_tail()
01196         { m_left.clean_tail(); m_right.clean_tail(); }
01197 
01198 
01199     // other methods
01200 
01201     bool is_01() const
01202         { return ( m_left.is_01() && m_right.is_01() ); }
01203 
01204 protected:
01205 
01206     X&           m_left;
01207     Y&           m_right;
01208     mutable int  m_delete;
01209     int&         m_refs;
01210 
01211 private:
01212 
01213     // disabled
01214     sc_concref_r();
01215     sc_concref_r<X,Y>& operator = ( const sc_concref_r<X,Y>& );
01216 };
01217

01468 
01469 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01470 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_concref<X,Y>
01471 //
01472 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy concatenation (r-value and l-value).
01473 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01474 
01475 template <class X, class Y>
01476 class sc_concref
01477     : public sc_concref_r<X,Y>
01478 {
01479 public:
01480 
01481     // typedefs
01482 
01483     typedef sc_concref_r<X,Y> base_type;
01484 
01485 
01486     // constructor
01487 
01488     sc_concref( X& left_, Y& right_, int delete_ = 0 )
01489         : sc_concref_r<X,Y>( left_, right_, delete_ )
01490         {}
01491 
01492 
01493     // copy constructor
01494 
01495     sc_concref( const sc_concref<X,Y>& a )
01496         : sc_concref_r<X,Y>( a )
01497         {}
01498 
01499 
01500     // cloning
01501 
01502     sc_concref<X,Y>* clone() const
01503         { return new sc_concref<X,Y>( *this ); }
01504 
01505 
01506     // assignment operators
01507 
01508     template <class Z>
01509     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const sc_proxy<Z>& a )
01510         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01511 
01512     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const sc_concref<X,Y>& a )
01513         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01514 
01515     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const char* a )
01516         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01517 
01518     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const bool* a )
01519         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01520 
01521     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const sc_logic* a )
01522         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01523 
01524     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const sc_unsigned& a )
01525         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01526 
01527     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const sc_signed& a )
01528         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01529 
01530     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const sc_uint_base& a )
01531         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01532 
01533     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( const sc_int_base& a )
01534         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01535 
01536     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( unsigned long a )
01537         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01538 
01539     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( long a )
01540         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01541 
01542     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( unsigned int a )
01543         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01544 
01545     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( int a )
01546         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01547 
01548     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( uint64 a )
01549         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01550 
01551     sc_concref<X,Y>& operator = ( int64 a )
01552         { base_type::assign_( a ); return *this; }
01553 
01554 
01555     // other methods
01556 
01557     void scan( ::std::istream& = ::std::cin );
01558 
01559 private:
01560 
01561     // disabled
01562     sc_concref();
01563 };
01564

01917 // IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
01918 
01919 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01920 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_bitref_r<T>
01921 //
01922 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy bit selection (r-value only).
01923 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01924 
01925 // bitwise operators and functions
01926 
01927 // bitwise and
01928 
01929 template <class T1, class T2>
01930 inline
01931 sc_logic
01932 operator & ( const sc_bitref_r<T1>& a, const sc_bitref_r<T2>& b )
01933 {
01934     return sc_logic( sc_logic::and_table[a.value()][b.value()] );
01935 }
01936 
01937 
01938 // bitwise or
01939 
01940 template <class T1, class T2>
01941 inline
01942 sc_logic
01943 operator | ( const sc_bitref_r<T1>& a, const sc_bitref_r<T2>& b )
01944 {
01945     return sc_logic( sc_logic::or_table[a.value()][b.value()] );
01946 }
01947 
01948 
01949 // bitwise xor
01950 
01951 template <class T1, class T2>
01952 inline
01953 sc_logic
01954 operator ^ ( const sc_bitref_r<T1>& a, const sc_bitref_r<T2>& b )
01955 {
01956     return sc_logic( sc_logic::xor_table[a.value()][b.value()] );
01957 }
01958 
01959 
01960 // relational operators and functions
01961 
01962 template <class T1, class T2>
01963 inline
01964 bool
01965 operator == ( const sc_bitref_r<T1>& a, const sc_bitref_r<T2>& b )
01966 {
01967     return ( (int) a.value() == b.value() );
01968 }
01969 
01970 template <class T1, class T2>
01971 inline
01972 bool
01973 operator != ( const sc_bitref_r<T1>& a, const sc_bitref_r<T2>& b )
01974 {
01975     return ( (int) a.value() != b.value() );
01976 }
01977 
01978 
01979 // common methods
01980 
01981 template <class T>
01982 inline
01983 typename sc_bitref_r<T>::value_type
01984 sc_bitref_r<T>::get_bit( int n ) const
01985 {
01986     if( n == 0 ) {
01987         return m_obj.get_bit( m_index );
01988     } else {
01989         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_ , 0 );
01990         return Log_0;
01991     }
01992 }
01993 
01994 
01995 template <class T>
01996 inline
01997 sc_digit
01998 sc_bitref_r<T>::get_word( int n ) const
01999 {
02000     if( n == 0 ) {
02001         return ( get_bit( n ) & SC_DIGIT_ONE );
02002     } else {
02003         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
02004         return 0;
02005     }
02006 }
02007 
02008 template <class T>
02009 inline
02010 sc_digit
02011 sc_bitref_r<T>::get_cword( int n ) const
02012 {
02013     if( n == 0 ) {
02014         return ( (get_bit( n ) & SC_DIGIT_TWO) >> 1 );
02015     } else {
02016         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
02017         return 0;
02018     }
02019 }

02247 
02248 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02249 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_bitref<X>
02250 //
02251 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy bit selection (r-value and l-value).
02252 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02253 
02254 // assignment operators
02255 
02256 template <class X>
02257 inline
02258 sc_bitref<X>&
02259 sc_bitref<X>::operator = ( const sc_bitref_r<X>& a )
02260 {
02261     this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index, a.value() );
02262         return *this;
02263 }
02264 
02265 template <class X>
02266 inline
02267 sc_bitref<X>&
02268 sc_bitref<X>::operator = ( const sc_bitref<X>& a )
02269 {
02270     if( &a != this ) {
02271         this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index, a.value() );
02272     }
02273     return *this;
02274 }
02275 
02276 
02277 // bitwise assignment operators
02278 
02279 template <class X>
02280 inline
02281 sc_bitref<X>&
02282 sc_bitref<X>::operator &= ( const sc_bitref_r<X>& a )
02283 {
02284     if( &a != this ) {
02285         this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index,
02286                              sc_logic::and_table[this->value()][a.value()] );
02287     }
02288     return *this;
02289 }
02290 
02291 template <class X>
02292 inline
02293 sc_bitref<X>&
02294 sc_bitref<X>::operator &= ( const sc_logic& a )
02295 {
02296     this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index,
02297                          sc_logic::and_table[this->value()][a.value()] );
02298     return *this;
02299 }
02300 
02301 
02302 template <class X>
02303 inline
02304 sc_bitref<X>&
02305 sc_bitref<X>::operator |= ( const sc_bitref_r<X>& a )
02306 {
02307     if( &a != this ) {
02308         this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index,
02309                              sc_logic::or_table[this->value()][a.value()] );
02310     }
02311     return *this;
02312 }
02313 
02314 template <class X>
02315 inline
02316 sc_bitref<X>&
02317 sc_bitref<X>::operator |= ( const sc_logic& a )
02318 {
02319     this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index,
02320                          sc_logic::or_table[this->value()][a.value()] );
02321     return *this;
02322 }
02323 
02324 
02325 template <class X>
02326 inline
02327 sc_bitref<X>&
02328 sc_bitref<X>::operator ^= ( const sc_bitref_r<X>& a )
02329 {
02330     if( &a != this ) {
02331         this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index,
02332                              sc_logic::xor_table[this->value()][a.value()] );
02333     }
02334     return *this;
02335 }
02336 
02337 template <class X>
02338 inline
02339 sc_bitref<X>&
02340 sc_bitref<X>::operator ^= ( const sc_logic& a )
02341 {
02342     this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index,
02343                          sc_logic::xor_table[this->value()][a.value()] );
02344     return *this;
02345 }
02346 
02347 
02348 // bitwise operators and functions
02349 
02350 // bitwise complement
02351 
02352 template <class X>
02353 inline
02354 sc_bitref<X>&
02355 sc_bitref<X>::b_not()
02356 {
02357     this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index,
02358                          sc_logic::not_table[this->value()] );
02359     return *this;
02360 }
02361 
02362 
02363 // common methods
02364 
02365 template <class X>
02366 inline
02367 void
02368 sc_bitref<X>::set_bit( int n, value_type value )
02369 {
02370     if( n == 0 ) {
02371         this->m_obj.set_bit( this->m_index, value );
02372     } else {
02373         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
02374     }
02375 }
02376 
02377 template <class X>
02378 inline
02379 void
02380 sc_bitref<X>::set_word( int n, sc_digit w )
02381 {
02382     unsigned int bi = this->m_index % (8*sizeof(sc_digit));
02383     sc_digit     temp;
02384     unsigned int wi = this->m_index / (8*sizeof(sc_digit));
02385     if( n == 0 ) {
02386         temp = this->m_obj.get_word(wi);
02387         temp = (temp & ~(1 << bi)) | ((w&1) << bi);
02388         this->m_obj.set_word(wi, temp);
02389     } else {
02390         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
02391     }
02392 
02393 }
02394 
02395 template <class X>
02396 inline
02397 void
02398 sc_bitref<X>::set_cword( int n, sc_digit w )
02399 {
02400     unsigned int bi = this->m_index % (8*sizeof(sc_digit));
02401     sc_digit     temp;
02402     unsigned int wi = this->m_index / (8*sizeof(sc_digit));
02403     if( n == 0 ) {
02404         temp = this->m_obj.get_cword(wi);
02405         temp = (temp & ~(1 << bi)) | ((w&1) << bi);
02406         this->m_obj.set_cword(wi, temp);
02407     } else {
02408         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
02409     }
02410 }
02411 
02412 // other methods
02413 
02414 template <class X>
02415 inline
02416 void
02417 sc_bitref<X>::scan( ::std::istream& is )
02418 {
02419     char c;
02420     is >> c;
02421     *this = c;
02422 }

02474 inline
02475 sc_concref<sc_bitref<T1>,sc_subref<T2> >
02476 concat( sc_bitref<T1> a, sc_subref<T2> b )
02477 {
02478     return sc_concref<sc_bitref<T1>,sc_subref<T2> >(
02479         *a.clone(), *b.clone(), 3 );
02480 }
02481 
02482 template <class T1, class T2, class T3>
02483 inline
02484 sc_concref<sc_bitref<T1>,sc_concref<T2,T3> >
02485 concat( sc_bitref<T1> a, sc_concref<T2,T3> b )
02486 {
02487     return sc_concref<sc_bitref<T1>,sc_concref<T2,T3> >(
02488         *a.clone(), *b.clone(), 3 );
02489 }
02490 
02491 template <class T1, class T2>
02492 inline
02493 sc_concref<sc_bitref<T1>,T2>
02494 concat( sc_bitref<T1> a, sc_proxy<T2>& b )
02495 {
02496     return sc_concref<sc_bitref<T1>,T2>(
02497         *a.clone(), b.back_cast(), 1 );
02498 }
02499 
02500 
02501 template <class X>
02502 inline
02503 ::std::istream&
02504 operator >> ( ::std::istream& is, sc_bitref<X> a )
02505 {
02506     a.scan( is );
02507     return is;
02508 }
02509 
02510 
02511 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02512 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_subref_r<X>
02513 //
02514 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy part selection (r-value only).
02515 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02516 
02517 template <class X>
02518 inline
02519 void
02520 sc_subref_r<X>::check_bounds()
02521 {
02522     int len = m_obj.length();
02523     if( m_hi < 0 || m_hi >= len || m_lo < 0 || m_lo >= len ) {
02524         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
02525         sc_core::sc_abort(); // can't recover from here
02526     }
02527     if( reversed() ) {
02528         m_len = m_lo - m_hi + 1;
02529     } else {
02530         m_len = m_hi - m_lo + 1;
02531     }
02532 }
02533 
02534 
02535 // common methods
02536 
02537 template <class X>
02538 inline
02539 typename sc_subref_r<X>::value_type
02540 sc_subref_r<X>::get_bit( int n ) const
02541 {
02542     if( reversed() ) {
02543         return m_obj.get_bit( m_lo - n );
02544     } else {
02545         return m_obj.get_bit( m_lo + n );
02546     }
02547 }
02548 
02549 template <class X>
02550 inline
02551 void
02552 sc_subref_r<X>::set_bit( int n, value_type value )
02553 {
02554     if( reversed() ) {
02555         m_obj.set_bit( m_lo - n, value );
02556     } else {
02557         m_obj.set_bit( m_lo + n, value );
02558     }
02559 }
02560 
02561 
02562 template <class X>
02563 inline
02564 sc_digit
02565 sc_subref_r<X>::get_word( int i ) const
02566 {
02567     int n1 = 0;
02568     int n2 = 0;
02569     sc_digit result = 0;
02570     int k = 0;
02571     if( reversed() ) {
02572         n1 = m_lo - i * SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
02573         n2 = sc_max( n1 - SC_DIGIT_SIZE, m_hi - 1 );
02574         for( int n = n1; n > n2; n -- ) {
02575             result |= (m_obj[n].value() & SC_DIGIT_ONE) << k ++;
02576         }
02577     } else {
02578         n1 = m_lo + i * SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
02579         n2 = sc_min( n1 + SC_DIGIT_SIZE, m_hi + 1 );
02580         for( int n = n1; n < n2; n ++ ) {
02581             result |= (m_obj[n].value() & SC_DIGIT_ONE) << k ++;
02582         }
02583     }
02584     return result;
02585 }
02586 
02587 template <class X>
02588 inline
02589 void
02590 sc_subref_r<X>::set_word( int i, sc_digit w )
02591 {
02592     int n1 = 0;
02593     int n2 = 0;
02594     int k = 0;
02595     if( reversed() ) {
02596         n1 = m_lo - i * SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
02597         n2 = sc_max( n1 - SC_DIGIT_SIZE, m_hi - 1 );
02598         for( int n = n1; n > n2; n -- ) {
02599             m_obj.set_bit( n, value_type(
02600                                       ( (w >> k ++) & SC_DIGIT_ONE ) |
02601                                       ( m_obj[n].value() & SC_DIGIT_TWO ) ) );
02602         }
02603     } else {
02604         n1 = m_lo + i * SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
02605         n2 = sc_min( n1 + SC_DIGIT_SIZE, m_hi + 1 );
02606         for( int n = n1; n < n2; n ++ ) {
02607             m_obj.set_bit( n, value_type(
02608                                         ( (w >> k ++) & SC_DIGIT_ONE ) |
02609                                         ( m_obj[n].value() & SC_DIGIT_TWO ) ) );
02610         }
02611     }
02612 }
02613 
02614 
02615 template <class X>
02616 inline
02617 sc_digit
02618 sc_subref_r<X>::get_cword( int i ) const
02619 {
02620     int n1 = 0;
02621     int n2 = 0;
02622     sc_digit result = 0;
02623     int k = 0;
02624     if( reversed() ) {
02625         n1 = m_lo - i * SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
02626         n2 = sc_max( n1 - SC_DIGIT_SIZE, m_hi - 1 );
02627         for( int n = n1; n > n2; n -- ) {
02628             result |= ((m_obj[n].value() & SC_DIGIT_TWO) >> 1) << k ++;
02629         }
02630     } else {
02631         n1 = m_lo + i * SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
02632         n2 = sc_min( n1 + SC_DIGIT_SIZE, m_hi + 1 );
02633         for( int n = n1; n < n2; n ++ ) {
02634             result |= ((m_obj[n].value() & SC_DIGIT_TWO) >> 1) << k ++;
02635         }
02636     }
02637     return result;
02638 }
02639 
02640 template <class X>
02641 inline
02642 void
02643 sc_subref_r<X>::set_cword( int i, sc_digit w )
02644 {
02645     int n1 = 0;
02646     int n2 = 0;
02647     int k = 0;
02648     if( reversed() ) {
02649         n1 = m_lo - i * SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
02650         n2 = sc_max( n1 - SC_DIGIT_SIZE, m_hi - 1 );
02651         for( int n = n1; n > n2; n -- ) {
02652             m_obj.set_bit( n, value_type(
02653                                      ( ((w >> k ++) & SC_DIGIT_ONE) << 1 ) |
02654                                      ( m_obj[n].value() & SC_DIGIT_ONE ) ) );
02655         }
02656     } else {
02657         n1 = m_lo + i * SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
02658         n2 = sc_min( n1 + SC_DIGIT_SIZE, m_hi + 1 );
02659         for( int n = n1; n < n2; n ++ ) {
02660             m_obj.set_bit( n, value_type(
02661                                         ( ((w >> k ++) & SC_DIGIT_ONE) << 1 ) |
02662                                         ( m_obj[n].value() & SC_DIGIT_ONE ) ) );
02663         }
02664     }
02665 }
02666 
02667 
02668 // other methods
02669 
02670 template <class X>
02671 inline
02672 bool
02673 sc_subref_r<X>::is_01() const
02674 {
02675     int sz = size();
02676     for( int i = 0; i < sz; ++ i ) {
02677         if( get_cword( i ) != SC_DIGIT_ZERO ) {
02678             return false;
02679         }
02680     }
02681     return true;
02682 }

02929 {

02933 }

03020 
03021 
03022 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03023 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_concref_r<X,Y>
03024 //
03025 //  Proxy class for sc_proxy concatenation (r-value only).
03026 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03027 
03028 // destructor
03029 
03030 template <class X, class Y>
03031 inline
03032 sc_concref_r<X,Y>::~sc_concref_r()
03033 {
03034     if( -- m_refs == 0 ) {
03035         delete &m_refs;
03036         if( m_delete == 0 ) {
03037             return;
03038         }
03039         if( m_delete & 1 ) {
03040             delete &m_left;
03041         }
03042         if( m_delete & 2 ) {
03043             delete &m_right;
03044         }
03045     }
03046 }
03047 
03048 
03049 // common methods
03050 
03051 template <class X, class Y>
03052 inline
03053 typename sc_concref_r<X,Y>::value_type
03054 sc_concref_r<X,Y>::get_bit( int n ) const
03055 {
03056     int r_len = m_right.length();
03057     if( n < r_len ) {
03058         return value_type(m_right.get_bit( n ));
03059     } else if( n < r_len + m_left.length() ) {
03060         return value_type(m_left.get_bit( n - r_len ));
03061     } else {
03062         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
03063         return Log_0;
03064     }
03065 }
03066 
03067 template <class X, class Y>
03068 inline
03069 void
03070 sc_concref_r<X,Y>::set_bit( int n, value_type v )
03071 {
03072     int r_len = m_right.length();
03073     if( n < r_len ) {
03074         m_right.set_bit( n, typename Y::value_type(v) );
03075     } else if( n < r_len + m_left.length() ) {
03076         m_left.set_bit( n - r_len, typename X::value_type(v) );
03077     } else {
03078         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
03079     }
03080 }
03081 
03082 
03083 template <class X, class Y>
03084 inline
03085 sc_digit
03086 sc_concref_r<X,Y>::get_word( int i ) const
03087 {
03088     if( i < 0 || i >= size() ) {
03089         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
03090     }
03091     // 0 <= i < size()
03092     Y& r = m_right;
03093     int r_len = r.length();
03094     int border = r_len / SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
03095     if( i < border ) {
03096         return r.get_word( i );
03097     }
03098     // border <= i < size()
03099     X& l = m_left;
03100     int shift = r_len % SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
03101     int j = i - border;
03102     if( shift == 0 ) {
03103         return l.get_word( j );
03104     }
03105     // border <= i < size() && shift != 0
03106     int nshift = SC_DIGIT_SIZE - shift;
03107     if( i == border ) {
03108         sc_digit rl_mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO >> nshift;
03109         return ( (r.get_word( i ) & rl_mask) | (l.get_word( 0 ) << shift) );
03110     }
03111     // border < i < size() && shift != 0
03112     if ( j < l.size() )
03113         return ( (l.get_word( j - 1 ) >> nshift) | (l.get_word( j ) << shift) );
03114     else
03115         return (l.get_word( j - 1 ) >> nshift);
03116 }
03117 
03118 template <class X, class Y>
03119 inline
03120 void
03121 sc_concref_r<X,Y>::set_word( int i, sc_digit w )
03122 {
03123     if( i < 0 || i >= size() ) {
03124         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
03125     }
03126     // 0 <= i < size()
03127     Y& r = m_right;
03128     int r_len = r.length();
03129     int border = r_len / SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
03130     if( i < border ) {
03131         r.set_word( i, w );
03132         return;
03133     }
03134     // border <= i < size()
03135     X& l = m_left;
03136     int shift = r_len % SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
03137     int j = i - border;
03138     if( shift == 0 ) {
03139         l.set_word( j, w );
03140         return;
03141     }
03142     // border <= i < size() && shift != 0
03143     int nshift = SC_DIGIT_SIZE - shift;
03144     sc_digit lh_mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO << nshift;
03145     if( i == border ) {
03146         sc_digit rl_mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO >> nshift;
03147         r.set_word( i, w & rl_mask );
03148         l.set_word( 0, (l.get_word( 0 ) & lh_mask) | (w >> shift) );
03149         return;
03150     }
03151     // border < i < size() && shift != 0
03152     sc_digit ll_mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO >> shift;
03153     l.set_word( j - 1, (l.get_word( j - 1 ) & ll_mask) | (w << nshift) );
03154     if ( j < l.size() )
03155         l.set_word( j, (l.get_word( j ) & lh_mask) | (w >> shift) );
03156 }
03157 
03158 
03159 template <class X, class Y>
03160 inline
03161 sc_digit
03162 sc_concref_r<X,Y>::get_cword( int i ) const
03163 {
03164     if( i < 0 || i >= size() ) {
03165         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
03166     }
03167     // 0 <= i < size()
03168     Y& r = m_right;
03169     int r_len = r.length();
03170     int border = r_len / SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
03171     if( i < border ) {
03172         return r.get_cword( i );
03173     }
03174     // border <= i < size()
03175     X& l = m_left;
03176     int shift = r_len % SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
03177     int j = i - border;
03178     if( shift == 0 ) {
03179         return l.get_cword( j );
03180     }
03181     // border <= i < size() && shift != 0
03182     int nshift = SC_DIGIT_SIZE - shift;
03183     if( i == border ) {
03184         sc_digit rl_mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO >> nshift;
03185         return ( (r.get_cword( i ) & rl_mask) | (l.get_cword( 0 ) << shift) );
03186     }
03187     // border < i < size() && shift != 0
03188     if ( j < l.size() )
03189         return ( (l.get_cword(j - 1) >> nshift) | (l.get_cword(j) << shift) );
03190     else
03191         return (l.get_cword( j - 1 ) >> nshift);
03192 }
03193 
03194 template <class X, class Y>
03195 inline
03196 void
03197 sc_concref_r<X,Y>::set_cword( int i, sc_digit w )
03198 {
03199     if( i < 0 || i >= size() ) {
03200         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OUT_OF_BOUNDS_, 0 );
03201     }
03202     // 0 <= i < size()
03203     Y& r = m_right;
03204     int r_len = r.length();
03205     int border = r_len / SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
03206     if( i < border ) {
03207         r.set_cword( i, w );
03208         return;
03209     }
03210     // border <= i < size()
03211     X& l = m_left;
03212     int shift = r_len % SC_DIGIT_SIZE;
03213     int j = i - border;
03214     if( shift == 0 ) {
03215         l.set_cword( j, w );
03216         return;
03217     }
03218     // border <= i < size() && shift != 0
03219     int nshift = SC_DIGIT_SIZE - shift;
03220     sc_digit lh_mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO << nshift;
03221     if( i == border ) {
03222         sc_digit rl_mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO >> nshift;
03223         r.set_cword( i, w & rl_mask );
03224         l.set_cword( 0, (l.get_cword( 0 ) & lh_mask) | (w >> shift) );
03225         return;
03226     }
03227     // border < i < size() && shift != 0
03228     sc_digit ll_mask = ~SC_DIGIT_ZERO >> shift;
03229     l.set_cword( j - 1, (l.get_cword( j - 1 ) & ll_mask) | (w << nshift) );
03230     if ( j < l.size() )
03231         l.set_cword( j, (l.get_cword( j ) & lh_mask) | (w >> shift) );
03232 }

03473 {

03475     is >> s;
03476     *this = s.c_str();
03477 }

03593 template <class T1, class T2, class T3>
03594 inline

03904 // Revision 1.3  2007/01/18 19:29:18  acg
03905 //  Andy Goodrich: fixed bug in concatenations of bit selects on sc_lv and
03906 //  sc_bv types. The offending code was in sc_bitref<X>::set_word and
03907 //  sc_bitref<X>::get_word. These methods were not writing the bit they
03908 //  represented, but rather writing an entire word whose index was the
03909 //  index of the bit they represented. This not only did not write the
03910 //  correct bit, but clobbered a word that might not even be in the
03911 //  variable the reference was for.
03912 //
03913 // Revision 1.2  2007/01/17 22:45:08  acg
03914 //  Andy Goodrich: fixed sc_bitref<X>::set_bit().
